intro: Cuphea donkelaarii, commonly known as the crimson cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically shrub-like in growth habit. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-draining soil. Cuphea donkelaarii is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like hummingbirds.
